intro: Noronhia longipedicellata, commonly known as the long-stalked noronhia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and clusters of small, white flowers that bloom in the summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in humid lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
